title: Authors and Citation
text: Werake R (2024). grasslandbirds: Analyse Grassland Bird Population & Agriculutre Growth. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {grasslandbirds: Analyse Grassland Bird Population & Agriculutre Growth},   author = {Rachitha Werake},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Analyse Grassland Bird Population & Agriculutre Growth
title: Analyse Grassland Bird Population & Agriculutre Growth
text: goal grasslandbirds provide analysis comparison population grassland birds North America, production rate various livestock crops. population data based various grassland bird species recorded within Project Feederwatch survey (2000 - 2024). production rate, taken Food Agriculture Organisation United Nations (FAO), data shows amount livestock crops produced (tonnes) North America.

title: Analyse Grassland Bird Population & Agriculutre Growth
text: can install development version grasslandbirds GitHub :

title: Analyse Grassland Bird Population & Agriculutre Growth
text: basic example shows plot grassland bird population:  Moreover, interactive online app data can deployed using launch_app function, within package.
code: library(grasslandbirds) library(tidyverse) #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5 #> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1 #> ✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1 #> ✔ purrr     1.0.2      #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors  analysis_data %>%   ggplot(aes(x = Year, y = population)) +   geom_line()
